title: Privacy Policy
introduction: This privacy policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your information in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

responsable.title: 1. Data Controller
responsable.content: The controller of your personal data is:
responsable.name: LEVASSEUR Sten
responsable.note: As an individual operating DropIt, I am responsible for the collection and processing of your personal data.
responsable.contact: For any questions regarding your personal data or the exercise of your rights, you can contact me at the email address above.

donneesCollectees.title: 2. Personal Data Collected
donneesCollectees.intro: We collect and process the following categories of personal data:

compte.title: User Account Data
items: Password (encrypted with bcrypt, never stored in plain text)

athlete.title: Athlete Profile Data
items: Competitor status (level, sex category, weight category)

organisation.title: Organization Data
items: Role and permissions within the organization

finalites.title: 3. Processing Purposes
finalites.intro: Your personal data is collected and processed for the following purposes:

items.reason: To allow you to securely access your account
To provide you with a personalized training tracking and planning service
To determine age and weight categories for competitions
To allow you to visualize your evolution and performance
To inform you about important events related to your account
To protect your account against unauthorized access and detect suspicious activities
To enable collaboration between coaches and athletes within a club

baseLegale.title: 4. Legal Basis for Processing
baseLegale.intro: In accordance with Article 6 of the GDPR, we process your personal data on the following legal bases:

bases.description: You consented to the processing of your personal data when you signed up by accepting this privacy policy through the mandatory checkbox.
The processing is necessary for the performance of the service you requested: managing your sports training and tracking your performance.
We have a legitimate interest in processing certain data to ensure platform security and prevent fraud.

conservation.title: 5. Data Retention Period
conservation.intro: We retain your personal data only for as long as necessary for the purposes for which it was collected:

durations.duration: As long as you actively use the service
durations.details: All your data is retained as long as your account is active.
If you do not log in for 24 consecutive months, we will send you a warning email at 22 months, then automatically delete your account and all your data.
Expired session tokens are automatically deleted after 90 days.
Technical logs (logins, IP addresses) are kept for 12 months for security and traceability purposes.
Tokens sent by email to verify your address expire after 24 hours.
Password reset links expire after 1 hour for security reasons.
When you delete your account, all your personal data is immediately and permanently deleted from our servers (hard delete). No copy is retained.

conservation.note: Anonymized and aggregated data (statistics without personal identification) may be retained indefinitely for analysis purposes.

droits.title: 6. Your GDPR Rights
droits.intro: In accordance with Articles 15 to 22 of the GDPR, you have the following rights regarding your personal data:

rights.name: Right of access (Art. 15)
rights.description: You have the right to obtain confirmation that data concerning you is being processed and to access that data.
rights.howTo: Access your Profile page in the application to view all your data.

rights.name: Right to rectification (Art. 16)
rights.description: You can request the correction of your inaccurate or incomplete data.
rights.howTo: Directly edit your information from your Profile page > My Profile or Athlete Profile.

rights.name: Right to erasure / Right to be forgotten (Art. 17)
rights.description: You can request the deletion of your personal data.
rights.howTo: Use the 'Delete my account' button in Profile > Danger Zone. You will need to confirm with your email, password and the word 'DELETE'.

rights.name: Right to data portability (Art. 20)
rights.description: You have the right to receive your data in a structured and commonly used format (JSON).
rights.howTo: Use the 'Download my data' button on your Profile page (feature coming soon).

rights.name: Right to object (Art. 21)
rights.description: You can object to the processing of your data for reasons relating to your particular situation.
rights.howTo: Contact us at [YOUR EMAIL] explaining your situation.

rights.name: Right to restriction of processing (Art. 18)
rights.description: You can request the restriction of the processing of your data under certain circumstances.
rights.howTo: Contact us at [YOUR EMAIL] to make your request.

rights.name: Right to withdraw consent
rights.description: You can withdraw your consent at any time for processing based on it.
rights.howTo: Delete your account via Profile > Danger Zone.

exercice.title: How to exercise your rights?
methods: Directly from your Profile page (/profile) for viewing, editing and deletion
By email at [YOUR EMAIL] for any other request
We commit to responding to any request within a maximum of 1 month

localisation.title: 7. Data Location and Hosting
localisation.intro: Your personal data is hosted and processed in the European Union:

infrastructure.details: VPS hosted by Infomaniak with PostgreSQL for data storage
Orchestration platform for managing Docker containers
Email service for notifications, verifications and password resets

localisation.transfert: No personal data is transferred outside the European Union. All your data remains hosted in Europe and is protected by GDPR.

soustraitants.title: Subcontractors and partners
soustraitants.intro: We work with the following subcontractors, all GDPR compliant:
list: Infomaniak: Server and PostgreSQL database hosting
Brevo: Transactional email delivery (email verification, password reset)
soustraitants.engagement: We commit to never sell, rent or share your personal data for commercial or advertising purposes.
soustraitants.partage: Your data is only shared with:
conditions: The subcontractors mentioned above, strictly for the provision of the service
Your organization's administrators (coach, club admin) if you are part of a club
Competent authorities in case of legal obligation or judicial request
With your explicit consent for any other sharing

cookies.title: 8. Cookies and Similar Technologies
cookies.intro: We use cookies strictly necessary for the operation of the service. No advertising or tracking cookies are used.

types.name: Authentication session cookie
types.purpose: To keep your session active after login
types.type: Strictly necessary cookie (no consent required under GDPR)
types.security: HttpOnly (inaccessible via JavaScript), Secure (HTTPS only), SameSite=Lax (CSRF protection)

cookies.analytics: We currently do not use any third-party analytics, advertising or tracking cookies (Google Analytics, Facebook Pixel, etc.).
cookies.gestion: You can manage or delete cookies through your browser settings. Warning: deleting the session cookie will log you out of the application.

securite.title: 9. Data Security
securite.intro: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal data against loss, misuse, unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration or destruction.

measures: Passwords encrypted with bcrypt (never stored in plain text)
Encrypted communications between server and database
Strict authentication to access the database
Principle of least privilege (access limited to strict necessity)
Business continuity plan in case of incident
Software dependencies kept up to date

securite.incident: In the event of a personal data breach likely to pose a risk to your rights and freedoms, we will inform you within 72 hours in accordance with Article 33 of the GDPR.

mineur.title: 10. Data of Minors
mineur.content: Our service is intended for users of all ages, including minors practicing weightlifting.
mineur.consentement: For minors under 15 years of age, consent to data processing must be given or authorized by the holder of parental authority.
mineur.responsabilite: We ask parents or legal guardians to supervise their minor children's use of the service.
mineur.verification: If you believe a minor has provided data without required parental consent, contact us at [YOUR EMAIL] so we can take appropriate action.

reclamation.title: 11. Right to Lodge a Complaint with the CNIL
reclamation.intro: If you believe that the processing of your personal data constitutes a violation of the GDPR, you have the right to lodge a complaint with the competent supervisory authority:

cnil.name: CNIL (National Commission for Information Technology and Liberties)
cnil.address: 3 Place de Fontenoy, TSA 80715, 75334 PARIS CEDEX 07, France

reclamation.autre: If you reside in another European Union country, you can also contact the data protection authority of your country of residence.
reclamation.avant: Before lodging a complaint, we encourage you to contact us directly at [YOUR EMAIL] so that we can resolve your concern amicably.

modifications.title: 12. Changes to the Privacy Policy
modifications.content: We reserve the right to modify this privacy policy at any time to reflect changes in our practices, our service, or legal obligations.
modifications.notification: In the event of a substantial modification, we will inform you by:
moyens: A visible notice on the application's home page
An email to the address associated with your account
modifications.date: The date of last update is indicated at the top of this document.
modifications.acceptation: By continuing to use our service after the publication of modifications, you accept the revised privacy policy.

contact.title: Contact
contact.description: For any questions regarding this privacy policy or the processing of your personal data, you can contact us at:
contact.delai: We commit to responding to any request within a maximum of one month.
